column4: There is the UT series, the Quake series and iirc the Doom series, there is also Nexius, that new game i'm not sure of the name, there are too many to mention...
I've heard good things about Americas Army also...
I was about to mention that one.
infact, screw this, if you want to know some good games instead of me telling them all over IRC read for yourself: http://techgage.com/article/top_10_free_linux_games/4
there isn't a lot. But hopefully the situation will improve as linux gains popularity.
they ARE the best for obvious reasons.
why? because they are marketed? I don't thing so..
No, obviously marketing does nothing for the quality of the game, but think about it. Do actually hope to see a game like oblivion as open source?
I don't want to see anything as open source, I want to see software as Free software...
they aren't always, take GNU/Linux for example, it's not marketed or (usually) in the shops, yet it's far superior to other OS'
it's not a game and took over 10 years to develop. You think that someone is going to go through all that trouble to make a... game?
